p: We used standard WHO case definition to investigate the outbreak.[ 11] Acute illness was defined as symptoms of acute jaundice, dark urine, anorexia, malaise, extreme fatigue, and right upper quadrant tenderness. Biological signs included increased urine urobilinogen and >2.5 times the upper limit of serum alanine aminotransferase. A case positive for IgM anti-HAV was labeled as hepatitis A, and positive for IgM anti-HEV labeled as hepatitis E. The suspected case was defined as a case if compatible with the clinical description. The confirmed case was defined as a suspected case that is laboratory-confirmed for hepatitis A and E.
